meanings.definition: A long, slender, soft-bodied invertebrate animal.
meanings.sent1: The worm wriggled in the dirt.
meanings.sent2: I saw a worm crawling on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: Why did the bird chase the worm?
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like a golden worm flowing down her back.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman baited his hook with a juicy worm.

meanings.definition: To move or progress slowly and laboriously.
meanings.sent1: The line at the store seemed to worm on forever.
meanings.sent2: I had to worm my way through the crowded room.
meanings.sent3: He tried to worm out of doing his chores.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to worm its way through the day.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree wormed their way through the cracks in the sidewalk.

meanings.definition: A computer program that replicates itself and spreads to other computers.
meanings.sent1: The worm infected many computers in the network.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to click on suspicious links to avoid a worm attack.
meanings.sent3: The IT team worked tirelessly to remove the pesky worm.
meanings.sent4: The computer virus spread like a digital worm through the system.
meanings.sent5: The worm caused chaos by spreading rapidly across the internet.
